channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How to eat like an Olympian. Inside the world’s largest restaurant feeding over 15,000 athletes and prioritizing plant-based meals over meat
item.description: A sneak peek into four dishes being served at the Paris 2024 Athletes’ Village.

item.title: Boston Celtics' majority owner puts team up for sale weeks after NBA championship
item.description: The ownership group behind the Boston Celtics has put the team up for sale, weeks after it won the NBA championship.

item.title: Top banks have raced to up dividends after Fed stress tests — here’s how much
Financial markets are pricing in more inflation under another Trump presidency—and bond yields are surging
item.description: The uptick in Treasury yields was led by the longest maturities, with 30-year bonds up more than eight basis points to 4.65%, the highest level since May 31.

item.title: Paramount is hunting for a streaming partner, could kick off a wave of deals
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery has interest in merging Max and Paramount+, as Paramount looks to strike a deal for its money-losing streaming service.

item.title: Hedge-fund billionaire Dalio now fears November clash between political extremes
Bank of America data shows today marks beginning of the S&P 500’s ‘strongest’ average 10-day period of the year…over 96 years
item.description: Bank of America’s strategist Stephen Suttmeier says the S&P 500’s best performing 10 day period has started in July, going back to 1928.

item.title: Boost returns in your 60/40 portfolio with 'the magnificent others,' AllianceBernstein says
item.description: AllianceBernstein says dividend-paying stocks look attractive right now.

item.title: U.S. stocks on track to kick off year’s third quarter with gains — live coverage
France’s political chaos has already halted some economic reforms while markets weigh the worst-case scenario
item.description: “We are likely moving to a scenario of political stalemate and paralysis,” said Mohit Kumar, chief economist for Europe at Jefferies International.

item.title: A new index is using AI tools to measure U.S. economic growth in a broader way
item.description: The Zeta Economic Index, launched Monday, uses generative artificial intelligence to analyze what its developers call "trillions of behavioral signals."

item.title: BlackRock agrees to acquire privately held U.K.-based Preqin for $3.2 billion
Cup Noodles instant ramen adds s’mores flavor—a bid to prove it’s ‘not just a boring thing you’d buy because you’re on a budget’
item.description: The packaged noodle brand is the latest to appeal to Gen Z’s eccentric taste for strange flavor combinations.

item.title: Former Trump aide Steve Bannon begins four-month prison sentence for contempt of Congress
item.description: Steve Bannon is the second former Trump official to be jailed for defying a subpoena from the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot.

item.title: French stocks surge by most in nearly two years after first round of election
